articles.author: MARI YAMAGUCHI Associated Press
articles.title: Americans in Japan to trade one quarantine for another
articles.description: A group of Americans are cutting short a 14-day quarantine on the Diamond Princess cruise ship in the port of Yokohama, near Tokyo, to be whisked back to America
articles.content:
TOKYO -- 
Americans Cheryl and Paul Molesky are trading one coronavirus quarantine for another.

articles.author: The Associated Press
articles.title: 'Parasite' director Bong greeted by applause in South Korea
articles.description: The Oscar-winning director of the movie “Parasite" smiled and waved at a waiting crowd as he arrived home in South Korea
articles.content:
INCHEON, South Korea -- 
Director Bong Joon-ho smiled and waved at a waiting crowd on Sunday as he arrived home in South Korea, his first trip back since he won four Oscars for his movie Parasite, including the award for Best Picture.
The crowd clapped and … [+1061 chars]

articles.author: JIM GOMEZ Associated Press
articles.title: No handshakes: Viral outbreak spooks Asian places of worship
articles.description: Temporary restrictions and dwindling crowds in places of worship across Asia have underscored the extent of the scare over a viral outbreak that has permeated many aspects of life in the religiously diverse region
articles.content:
MANILA, Philippines -- 
In a popular Catholic church in the Philippines, nearly half of the pews were empty for Sunday Mass. The few hundred worshippers who showed up were asked to refrain from shaking others' hands or holding them during prayers to prevent … [+7140 chars]

articles.author: Ivan Pereira
articles.title: Coronavirus death reported in Taiwan, US cruise passengers released from quarantine
articles.description: A man has died in Taiwan from the coronavirus, according to Taiwanese health officials. This marks the fourth recorded death outside China.
articles.content:
Another coronavirus-related death was reported outside of China this weekend.
An unidentified man in his 60s was first admitted to a hospital on Feb. 3 after he developed a cough a week earlier, Taiwan's Ministry of Health and Welfare said in a statement. He… [+2366 chars]

articles.author: SAM McNEIL and CANDICE CHOI Associated Press
articles.title: Virus renews safety concerns about slaughtering wild animals
articles.description: Many people in China are calling for a temporary ban on the wildlife trade to be made permanent as the coronavirus spreads
articles.content:
BEIJING -- 
China cracked down on the sale of exotic species after an outbreak of a new virus in 2002 was linked to markets selling live animals. The germ turned out to be a coronavirus that caused SARS.
The ban was later lifted, and the animals reappeared.… [+6543 chars]

articles.author: The Associated Press
articles.title: Quarantine ends for Germans; Italy to fly citizens from ship
articles.description: More than 100 Germans evacuated from the hard-hit Chinese city of Wuhan, the epicenter of a new coronavirus outbreak, were set to end their prescribed 14-day quarantine period on Sunday
articles.content:
BERLIN -- 
More than 100 Germans evacuated from the hard-hit Chinese city of Wuhan, the epicenter of a new coronavirus outbreak, were set to end their prescribed 14-day quarantine period on Sunday.

articles.author: Erin Schumaker
articles.title: How to interpret China changing how its counts coronavirus cases
articles.description: When China changed the criteria for diagnosing and reporting patients in with novel coronavirus this week, authorities reported a staggering 14,840 new cases overnight.
articles.content:
When China last week changed the criteria for diagnosing and reporting patients with novel coronavirus in Hubei province, the result was a staggering 14,840 new cases -- and from Wednesday night into Thursday, another 242 deaths.

articles.author: The Associated Press
articles.title: New virus has infected more than 69,000 people globally
articles.description: A viral outbreak that began in China has infected more than 69,000 people globally
articles.content:
A viral outbreak that began in China has infected more than 69,000 people globally. The World Health Organization has named the illness COVID-19, referring to its origin late last year and the coronavirus that causes it.

articles.title: China reports fall in new virus cases for 3rd straight day
articles.description: China has reported a drop in new virus cases for the third straight day
articles.content:
BEIJING -- 
China reported Sunday a drop in new virus cases for the third straight day.
There are 2,009 new cases in mainland China, bringing its total number of confirmed cases to 68,500, according to the country's National Health Commission.
